title: Opposition united only by hatred of PM Modi, says Kerala BJP chief Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: ‘The fact that INDI alliance represents not even one idea for bettering lives, for bettering India, has been known for several years now’, says the BJP leader

title: Stopping conflict a ‘big success’, level of anger was not a good thing: Trump
content: Mr. Trump has been continuously claiming that the U.S. brokered the ‘ceasefire’ between New Delhi and Islamabad but the Indian govt. has maintained that the DGMOs of the two countries arrived at an understanding to stop the conflict

title: When home is near the border
content: After days of living through heightened uncertainty following the targeting of civilians by Pakistan, villagers along the India-Pakistan border in Punjab are hoping that peace holds and their lives return to normalcy, reports Ishita Mishra

title: Haryana’s Nuh adopts sports-driven approach to combat drug abuse
content: Large turnout at sports events provides opportunity for organisers and officials to address various health and social issues, including rising tuberculosis cases, high dropout rates, and drug addiction

title: Telangana is a medical tourism hub drawing over one lakh visitors annually: Health Secretary
content: The State’s appeal is now expanding further to Southeast Asia and Europe, said Telangana Health Secretary Christina Z. Chongthu

title: Aurobindo Pharma arm launches leadership programme at IMTH
content: A six-month programme, the CLP aims to transform promising professionals into dynamic leaders by equipping them with skills in managing self, teams, business and change

title: Miss World contestants experience Telangana’s blend of eco-tourism and heritage
content: The day’s itinerary included visits to the Pillalamarri banyan tree in Mahabubnagar to eco-tourism haven of Experium Eco Park near Hyderabad

title: Kollam police books Kesari editor N.R. Madhu on charges of creating enmity between communities
content: Mr. Madhu had allegedly portrayed rapper Vedan, who hails from the Dalit community, as a “disreputable character” who makes a mockery of art and injects caste venom in society

title: India to do whatever is necessary to build ties with Afghanistan: officials
content: New Delhi to do ‘whatever is necessary’ to bolster relations, officials said after Minister S. Jaishankar talks with his Afghan counterpart; Centre considering aid for Afghans expelled by Pakistan.

title: Use drones to keep vigil on vulnerable places, Krishna SP tells personnel
content: Gangadhar Rao directs Station House Officers to address complaints received through Public Grievance Redressal System on a priority basis

title:
Amit Shah inaugurates revamped multi-agency network built
at ₹500 cr. to fight terrorism
content: As many as 28 organisations, including the Research and Analysis Wing (RAW), armed forces and State police, are part of the platform and various security agencies share real time intelligence inputs on MAC

title: U.K. determined to play role in improving India-Pakistan ties, fighting terror: Lammy
content: The U.K. Foreign Secretary strongly condemns terrorism and reminds of close ties that India and Pakistan enjoy with his country

title: Heavy rain, thunderstorm likely at some places in A.P. in next four days
content: Masada in Hukumpeta mandal of Alluri Sitharama Raju district and Ankampalle in Beluguppa mandal of Anantapur district recorded the highest rainfall of 18.5 mm on Friday

title: Nagpur woman goes missing in village along LoC in Kargil
content: Though her whereabouts were not known yet, police officials said that the woman had tried to cross over to Pakistan near Amritsar border in Punjab in March this year.

title: Murshidabad violence victims anxious about safety, State must ensure protection: Calcutta HC
content: The court notes that the committee report points to vandalism and massacre as ‘premeditated and an organised crime’; the court added that the victims’ demand for a permanent camp of Central forces shall be considered

title: BJP, BSP condemn SP leader Ram Gopal Yadav’s comments on Air Force officer Vyomika Singh
content: Mr. Yadav had sparked a controversy when he said Col. Sofiya Qureshi was being targeted by a BJP Minister as she is a Muslim, but Wg Cdr. Singh was spared thinking she was Rajput.

title: Sources: Purdy, 49ers reach 5-year, $265M deal
content: Brock Purdy, the last pick in the 2022 NFL draft who's gone on to become a Pro Bowler, is finalizing a 5-year, $265M deal with the 49ers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Bears' search for new home refocuses on suburb
content: The Bears' plans for a new domed stadium have shifted again, now focusing on a 326-acre property owned by the team in the Arlington Heights suburb.

title: ACC distributed record $45M per school in '23-24
content: The Atlantic Coast Conference generated $711 million for the 2023-24 academic year, distributing an average of $45 million to each of its 14 full-time member schools, a new record for the conference.

title: Dream pair: Griner happy in Atlanta; eyes Games
content: After an unexpected end to her time with the Mercury, 34-year-old Brittney Griner signed with the Dream and believes she's still got plenty left in the tank and hopes to play in the 2028 L.A. Olympics.

title: Once 'broken,' Homa finding groove at PGA
content: Transitioning to a new coach and new clubs, Max Homa shot a 7-under 64 in the second round of the PGA Championship on Friday to vault himself into contention.

title: Phillies place Nola on IL due to sprained ankle
content: The Phillies placed right-hander Aaron Nola on the 15-day injured list Friday with a right ankle sprain.

title: Tatum out of hospital, meets with C's ahead of G6
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum won't be far from Madison Square Garden when Boston faces a must-win situation against the New York Knicks on Friday night as the defending champions attempt to force a deciding Game 7.

title: Belichick on coaching at UNC: 'I learn every day'
content: North Carolina coach Bill Belichick discussed his new college team, what he has learned the most in his transition from the NFL, and yes, his girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, during a sit-down interview with "Good Morning America" on Friday.

title: ⚾ Will Aaron Judge hit .400? Blast 60 HRs?
content: The Yankees' superstar outfielder is outdoing even himself so far. Will he go over or under his current pace?

title: This is why the Knicks gave up all those picks for Mikal Bridges
content: Chris Herring examines why the Mikal Bridges-OG Anunoby duo is so important to the Knicks' closeout chances.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can the Maple Leafs force a Game 7?
content: Toronto must win to to keep the series going. Plus, catch up on Thursday's highlights and top players.

title: 2025 WNBA predictions: Staff picks to win title, MVP, more
content: New York seeks back-to-back titles and A'ja Wilson is after another MVP. But our expert picks lean toward the Lynx.

title: Golden State Valkyries open season with enthusiastic fans, low expectations
content: As the WNBA finally comes to the Bay Area, eager supporters seem willing to overlook roster question marks.

title: Derek Carr retired, then an avalanche of unanswered questions followed
content: Derek Carr surprisingly announced his retirement on May 10. The decision -- and the timing -- has insiders throughout the league talking.

title: Who are the best coaches in college football? We rank the top 10
content: Kirby Smart has to be No. 1, or does he? What about Ryan Day? Or Marcus Freeman? Who made our list -- and why.

title: Tiering 25 rookie running backs by expected role: Lead backs, committee options and depth backups
content: Which rookie RBs will make noise in 2025? We grouped 25 draft picks by expected Year 1 role, from Ashton Jeanty to Jacory Croskey-Merritt.

title: Bueckers' hometown temporarily renames itself after Wings rookie
content: Hopkins, Minnesota, will have a ribbon-cutting ceremony and watch party for Bueckers' first regular-season game.

title: Every Premier League team reranked: Spurs, Forest plummet; Man United can't bounce back
content: It's time to rank all 20 teams in the Premier League one final time! Did Man United or Man City bounce back? Could Forest and Tottenham hang on?

title: Salah: Don't boo TAA in final Liverpool games
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has called for fans not to boo teammate Trent Alexander-Arnold in the club's remaining games this season.

title: Pep: FA Cup trophy not first choice but we want it
content: Pep Guardiola has pushed back on the suggestion that winning the FA Cup was not one of Manchester City's priorities at the start of the season.

title: Sources: Chelsea keen on USWNT teen Yohannes
content: Chelsea are interested in signing United States teen Lily Yohannes this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: NWSL: Game should've stopped after King collapse
content: The National Women's Soccer League said that it would abandon future games that have life-threatening emergencies to players.

title: Galaxy extend coach despite record winless start
content: Head coach Greg Vanney has been given a multi-year contract extension by the defending MLS Cup champion LA Galaxy despite their historic 13-game winless skid to start the new season.

title: Brazil fed to elect prez before Ancelotti arrival
content: Brazil football federation (CBF) interim president Fernando Sarney on Friday set a date of May 25 for elections after Ednaldo Rodrigues was removed from his presidential post.

title: Everton's new home named Hill Dickinson Stadium
content: Everton have confirmed they have struck a deal with law firm Hill Dickinson to become the naming rights partner for the club's new stadium.

title: LAFC to host América May 31 for $10M CWC spot
content: LAFC will host LIGA MX powerhouse Club América on May 31 at BMO Stadium for a spot in this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Amid growing pains at Ferrari, will Hamilton win in F1 again?
content: Lewis Hamilton is not accustomed to losing, but he's been doing a lot of it. Will that ever change at Ferrari?

title: Welcome to Banditland: Buffalo eyeing an NLL championship three-peat
content: The Bandits are on the verge of history, while star Dhane Smith is also chasing down an all-time record -- owned by his coach.

title: UFC Fight Night: Does Burns have a best path to ending Morales' unbeaten run?
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Every NHL team's biggest prospect pipeline need -- and the draft prospects who could fill them
content: Only one out of 32 prospect pools is truly balanced. For the rest, here's what they need to do on June 27-28.

title: Fantasy facts vs. feelings on Clark, Bueckers and more
content: Liz Loza helps fantasy managers separate the facts from the feelings leading up to the start of the 2025 WNBA season.

title: FA Cup win won't save Man City, but it can kick-start their rebuild
content: Manchester City have had their fair share of struggles this season, but a win over Crystal Palace in the FA Cup final could spark their return to the top of English and European soccer.

title: Man City keep or dump: How should Guardiola & Co. rebuild?
content: It's been a bad season for Pep Guardiola and Man City, and it's clear they're in a full rebuild mode.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool in for Chelsea's Nkunku
content: Liverpool have joined the race for Chelsea forward Christopher Nkunku. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Opposition agrees to join govt.’s diplomatic outreach on India-Pakistan conflict
content: Centre to send eight delegations to Europe, West Asia and Africa and explain India’s stand on the conflict with Pak.; Rijiju dials senior leaders from Congress, CPI(M), DMK, AIMIM and other parties

title: WB govt. Staff hail court order directing State to pay 25% DA arrears
content: The decision will benefit 12 lakh employees and pensioners and is likely to cost ₹10,000 crore. Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari demanded Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee’s resignation over the matter

title: Handloom and Textiles tie up with SPA to modernise Lepakshi showrooms across AP
content: New showrooms will reflect the Andhra Pradesh’s rich history, handicrafts, handlooms and the essence of Telugu culture; the designs will be developed in collaboration with SPA (Vijayawada)

title: NIA conducts searches at 15 locations linked to Babbar Khalsa International in Punjab
content: The searches were carried out in Gurdaspur, Batala, Amritsar, and Kapurthala districts leading to the seizure of various incriminating materials, including mobiles/digital devices and documents

title: People of J&K want peace, not war: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
content: Delivering a customary sermon at the Jama masjid in Srinagar, the Mirwaiz highlighted the deaths of twins in Poonch in the recent military confrontation between India and Pakistan in J&K

title: Supreme Court’s three-month timeline in Tamil Nadu Governor verdict was adopted from Centre’s own guidelines
content: The Supreme Court’s April 8 judgment made it clear that it was merely adopting guidelines issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs

title: Non-functioning of Lok Adalats in 16 districts alarms Rajasthan High Court
content: Court takes suo motu cognisance of delay in tenure extension of presiding officers; flags serious threat to access to justice

title: Opposition mounts pressure on AAP after spurious liquor deaths
content: MLA Kunwar Vijay Pratap Singh criticises own government even as CM Bhagwant Mann urged to take full responsibility; calls for probe and accountability intensify

title: Telangana urges KWDT-II to rectify anomaly of assured irrigation compared to A.P. in Krishna Basin
content: Counsel for Telangana brings to Tribunal’s notice how erstwhile A.P. had placed projects serving outside basin areas in priority and neglected projects serving in-basin areas in TG

title: AG asked to speed up distribution of compensation to employees of Elstone Estate
content: The government is planning to build on the estate a township to accommodate the survivors of the Mundakkai-Chooralmala landslides

title: Supreme Court strikes down retrospective environmental clearances
content: The concept of an ex post facto EC is in derogation of the fundamental principles of environmental jurisprudence and is an anathema to the EIA Notification of January 27, 1994, says Bench

title: TNSTC bus conductor’s daughter scores 499 out of 500 in Class 10
content: She scored centum in four subjects and missed out centum in Tamil; TNSTC Kumbakonam MD felicitates her; she aspires to be a doctor

title: Teachers in West Bengal resume protests; police justify use of force as ‘minimal’
content: The use of force brought heavy criticism from Opposition political parties. Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari and other BJP leaders Sajal Ghosh and Kaustav Bagchi met the teachers on May 16

title: 27 families to get initial ₹10 lakh each today for relocation from Gawali village
content: Forest minister to visit Bhimgad Wildlife Sanctuary today as State govt. is facilitating voluntary relocation of residents from wildlife sanctuaries

title: Bihar Congress accuses State government of trying to thwart Rahul Gandhi’s event in Darbhanga
content: Despite the denial of permission, Rahul had addressed the gathering at the Darbhanga hostel, holding up a photograph of Dr. Ambedkar. Later, two FIRs were lodged against Mr. Gandhi and over 100 party workers

title: NH-66 widening project to be completed in December this year: P.A. Mohamed Riyas
content: Minister for General Education inaugurates over 50 PWD roads constructed in different districts and 12 smart roads in Thiruvananthapuram

title: CPI(M) rallies behind Vedan and Colonel Sofia Qureshi, portrays them as targets of RSS’s “casteism and communal hate”
content: Sangh Parivar’s reproachable denigration of Vedan and his crowd-pulling performances embodied RSS’s spite for persons from marginalised sections of society. RSS’s anti-Muslim spite manifested in a BJP Minister’s communal vitriol against Colonel Sofia Qureshi

title: Turkish firm Celebi moves Delhi HC against revoking of security clearance
content: The security clearance of the firm was revoked days after Turkiye backed Pakistan and condemned India's strikes on terror camps in the neighbouring country

title: Dreams of football fans in Kerala of watching Messi live dashed
content: Sports Minister announced in November last year that the Argentina national football team featuring Messi will play two exhibition matches against Japan and Qatar in Kerala in 2025.

title: Teacher unions boycott meeting with officials, demand immediate solutions to critical issues
content: Accusing the School Education Department officials of “unilaterally implementing policies’‘ without taking teachers’ suggestion into consideration, the unions threaten to intensify protests across the State

title: Monsoon draws near, but community squads to fight natural calamities are in disarray
content: Review meetings are yet to be convened to discuss the strengthening of community rescue squads and the enrolment of new members after field-level training by experts

title: R. Bindu launches CoE in drone pilot training, remote pilot training centre
content: The drone pilot training centre is the second Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA)-approved facility in Kerala

title: Press bodies express concern over arrest of Gujarat Samachar’s owner
content: Multiple organisations demand Bahubali Shah’s immediate release ‘unless credible evidence is presented in a transparent manner’

title: Southern Railway GM holds meetings with MPs, Constituency-wise infrastructure development works reviewed
content: Efforts are on to improve railway infrastructure under the Thiruvananthapuram Division, Railway officials say

title: Modi is a coward who fears Nehruvian ideology: Palakkad DCC president
content: The District Congress Committee president inaugurates a rally in protest against the Modi government’s decision to rename Nehru Yuva Kendra as Mera Yuva Bharat.

title: BJP takes out huge Tiranga Yatre in Hubballi
content: A huge march under the aegis of the BJP pays tribute to martyrs and celebrates the success of Operation Sindoor in Hubballi

title: Tumakuru metro extension: BMRCL submits feasibility study for 59.60-km stretch
content: Proposed stretch will feature 26 stations and, if approved, would become the first intercity metro corridor under the Namma Metro network.

title: How India can be big winner of Trump 2.0 era — if it plays its cards right
content: India is emerging as a promising investment destination amid global economic uncertainties, driven by its robust growth and potential trade deal with the US. Despite a slight downward revision in GDP forecast, investor confidence is surging, reflected in renewed capital inflows and a thriving domestic stock market.

title: INDIA bloc ‘frayed’, says Chidambaram, calls for coordination
content: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram voices worries about the INDIA bloc's unity. He emphasizes the need for a strong alliance to challenge the BJP. Chidambaram describes the BJP as a formidable and well-organized force. He suggests the BJP controls various institutions. His remarks highlight the challenges facing the opposition in India.

title: Neeraj Chopra finally breaches 90m barrier, finishes second in Doha DL
content: Neeraj Chopra made history at the Doha Diamond League 2025, crossing the 90-metre mark in javelin for the first time with a throw of 90.23m. Despite this personal best, he secured second place as Julian Weber of Germany won with 91.06m.

title: Govt to send all-party teams to brief nations on Pak-sponsored terrorism
content: To bolster its diplomatic efforts regarding Operation Sindoor, the government is dispatching five all-party parliamentary delegations worldwide to highlight Pakistan-sponsored terrorism. These delegations, comprising members from various parties, aim to showcase national unity on the issue. While most parties are participating, Congress expressed concerns about the government's direct outreach to its MPs instead of consulting the party leadership first.

title: Bill Gates on Mark Zuckerberg's plan to give away his wealth: There are people…
content: Bill Gates has praised Mark Zuckerberg's commitment to donate 90% of his wealth through the Chan-Zuckerberg Initiative, highlighting Zuckerberg as a key figure in the next generation of philanthropists. Gates himself plans to donate 99% of his wealth to the Gates Foundation within 20 years, emphasizing the growing trend of tech entrepreneurs engaging in significant charitable giving.

title: Supreme Court irked by repeated PILs to stop Rohingya deportation
content: The Supreme Court rebuked repeated PIL attempts to halt the alleged deportation of Rohingya Muslims, emphasizing that previous relief was denied on May 8. Senior Advocate Colin Gonsalves' plea, citing the deportation of 28 Rohingyas and threats to their lives in Myanmar, was met with skepticism due to lack of verifiable evidence.

title: Tasmac MD faces ED quizzing in Rs 1,000 crore graft case
content: Enforcement Directorate (ED) interrogated Tasmac MD S Visakan over suspected financial irregularities within the Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation. ED conducted searches at Visakan's residence and other locations, including the house of film producer Akash Baskaran. The investigation stems from a suspected ₹1,000 crore scam involving inflated bottle prices, based on DVAC FIRs.

title: SC grants Iskcon-Bengaluru control of city temple, overturns HC order
content: The Supreme Court resolved a 25-year legal dispute. Iskcon Bangalore gains control of the Hare Krishna temple. The court overturned a Karnataka High Court order. The dispute involved Iskcon Mumbai's claim. The court examined documents and witness statements. It favored Iskcon Bangalore's ownership. The ruling ends a long battle between the two factions.

title: Jamie Dimon to employees: Don't tell JPMorgan what to do, you can't learn from ...
content: JP Morgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is firm on the company's return-to-office mandate, asserting that employees will ultimately be happier. He emphasized the importance of in-person apprenticeship for younger staff, dismissing hybrid work models. Dimon has been a vocal critic of remote work, citing concerns about productivity, innovation, and spontaneous learning.

title: No chaos at major airports as other ground handlers step in
content: A recent government rule impacted operations of Turkiye's Celebi at nine Indian airports. Existing ground handling agencies stepped in to manage the workload. GMR Group made alternate arrangements at Goa's Mopa airport. Over 10,000 Celebi employees were absorbed by other handlers like Bird Group and AISATS. Operations have stabilized with no major disruptions.

title: Celebi moves Delhi HC against revocation of security clearance
content: Celebi Airport Services India challenges the revocation of its security clearance in Delhi High Court. The aviation watchdog BCAS took the action citing national security concerns. The firm argues the decision impacts thousands of jobs and investor confidence. Celebi denies any political affiliations and emphasizes its compliance with Indian regulations.

title: Precise intel big contributor in Sindoor’s success: Shah
content: Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated the upgraded Multi-Agency Centre (MAC), highlighting its role in coordinating efforts against national security threats. He credited 'Operation Sindoor' to strong political will, intelligence, and armed forces' capabilities. The upgraded MAC integrates AI and machine learning for advanced data analytics, aiming to combat terrorism and organized crime by connecting various databases and improving intelligence coordination.

title: Indian-origin man slammed for calling to send H-1B holders back
content: An Indian-origin man in the US, Rohit Joy, sparked controversy by suggesting the termination of the H-1B visa program and the return of its holders to their home countries. This proposal came in response to Congressman Dr. Rich McCormick's advocacy for domestic visa renewals.

title: As Pakistan reels from Op Sindoor, Baloch makes move to break free
content: Razzak Baloch asserts Pakistan's diminished control in Balochistan, urging international support for the Baloch struggle, particularly from India and the United States. Mir Yar Baloch has declared independence from Pakistan, highlighting historical grievances and alleged exploitation. The Baloch independence movement traces back to 1947, fueled by claims of forced annexation and human rights abuses.

title: Gujarat Samachar director held by ED, granted bail till May 31
content: Bahubali Shah, director of Gujarat Samachar Ltd, was granted interim bail until May 31 by a special PMLA court due to deteriorating health after his arrest by the Enforcement Directorate on money laundering charges. The arrest followed searches at multiple locations, and the ED did not object to temporary bail given Shah's condition.

title: 'Weaponising water': Omar, Mehbooba spar over IWT
content: Mehbooba Mufti has criticized Omar Abdullah's call to revive the Tulbul Navigation Project amidst India-Pakistan tensions. She deemed his statements irresponsible, emphasizing that J&K needs peace, not actions risking further conflict. Abdullah suggested resuming the project, suspended due to Pakistani objections under the Indus Water Treaty, now that the treaty is in abeyance.

title: Jnanpith Award conferred on Gulzar, Rambhadracharya
content: President Droupadi Murmu presented the 58th Jnanpith Award to Sanskrit scholar Jagadguru Rambhadracharya and poet-lyricist Gulzar for their contributions to literature. Rambhadracharya, a renowned Hindu leader and writer, was present to receive the award, while Gulzar was absent due to health reasons. Additionally, Hindi author Vinod Kumar Shukla has been named the recipient of the 59th Jnanpith Award for 2024.

title: CRPF officer killed by lightning while conducting anti-Naxal op
content: In a tragic incident, a senior CRPF officer lost his life, and three others sustained injuries due to a lightning strike during an anti-Maoist operation in Jharkhand's Saranda forests. The deceased, M Prabo Singh, was leading the joint operation when the unfortunate event occurred. The injured personnel have been airlifted to Ranchi for medical treatment.

title: Addicted to reels, Gujarat student breaks hand to skip exams
content: In Ahmedabad, a nursing student's addiction to watching reels led her to self-harm, fracturing her hand to avoid exams. Spending an average of 12 hours daily on short videos, she sought help from Tele MANAS, a mental health helpline. Post-COVID, screen time has surged, with the student receiving counselling and eventually taking her exams.

title: IIT-Roorkee joins institutions which have cut Turkiye links
content: IIT-Roorkee and other Indian universities cancelled agreements with Turkish counterparts. This decision follows similar moves by JNU and Jamia Millia Islamia. Lovely Professional University also ended collaborations with Turkiye and Azerbaijan. The universities cited national security and pro-Pakistan stances as reasons. The Association of Indian Universities urged a review of partnerships with Pakistan, Turkiye, and Bangladesh.

title: BJP mocks Pak’s military actions with 2007 T20 World Cup clip
content: BJP initiated a digital campaign against Pakistan, ridiculing their unsuccessful military response following Operation Sindoor. The party highlighted Pakistan's reliance on misinformation to fabricate victories, sharing a clip of India's 2007 T20 World Cup bowl-out win as a symbolic parallel. Amit Malviya criticized Pakistan's propaganda and Ishaq Dar's misleading statements, which were even debunked by Dawn newspaper.

title: Experts back Omar's demand for Tulbul Navigation Project revival in J&K
content: The Tulbul Navigation Project, stalled by Pakistan in 1987, may restart. Experts say it benefits Jammu and Kashmir. Omar Abdullah supports reviving the project. The project aims to improve navigation on the Jhelum river. It could also help with flood management and power generation. India believes the project aligns with the Indus Waters Treaty.

title: Revised anti-terror strategy leads to successful twin encounters in J&K
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, security forces intensified operations. Six terrorists were killed in Shopian and Tral. The number of local terrorists is now at a record low. Operations took place in forests and villages. Security forces are united in eradicating terrorism. Coordination among agencies is key to success in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Omar, Mufti spar over ‘weaponising’ water, patriotism, pro-Pakistan tilt
content: J&K CM Omar Abdullah's push to restart the Tulbul Navigation Project amid Indus Water Treaty discussions sparked a feud with PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti, who accused him of "weaponising water." The leaders clashed over patriotism and regional interests, with accusations of being pro-Pakistan. The project, stalled since 1987 due to Pakistani objections, aims to aid winter power generation.

title: PM congratulates people of Sikkim, NC asks about J&K's statehood
content: The National Conference has renewed its call for the restoration of statehood to Jammu and Kashmir, marking their first such demand since the Pahalgam terror attack. This appeal was made in response to PM Modi's greetings to Sikkim on its Statehood Day, with the NC urging the PM to grant J&K its rightful place.

title: Watch: Neeraj Chopra creates history, breaks the 90m barrier
content: Neeraj Chopra made history at the Doha Diamond League on Friday, May 16, 2025, becoming the first Indian javelin thrower to surpass the 90-metre mark with a stunning 90.23-metre throw. Under the guidance of new coach Jan Železný, Chopra dominated the competition, outperforming world-class athletes and setting a promising tone for the upcoming season.

title: Why Apple won’t find it easy to move iPhone production from India to US
content: Donald Trump has expressed his disapproval of Apple's expansion plans in India, urging CEO Tim Cook to shift iPhone production to the United States. Apple's current manufacturing setup in India accounts for 15% of its total production. But how easy is it for Apple to shift production to the US? We dive in:

title: Watch: Ritika Sajdeh in tears as Rohit Sharma stand inaugurated at Wankhede
content: The Mumbai Cricket Association honoured Rohit Sharma by unveiling the Rohit Sharma Stand at Wankhede Stadium. His wife, Ritika Sajdeh, was visibly moved during the ceremony. A video captured her emotional reaction as the stadium stand was renamed. Tributes poured in, including a message from Suryakumar Yadav. Akash Ambani, MI owner, attended the event.

title: 'Can't operate beyond FY26': VI's insolvency warning without govt support
content: Vodafone Idea has warned the Department of Telecommunications that it may not survive beyond FY26 without government assistance on adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues. The company is seeking a waiver of approximately Rs 30,000 crore in AGR dues and has proposed a payment plan to the government.

title: McDermott says the Buffalo Bills’ 2025 Schedule is hard on players, on their families
content: Buffalo Bills' 2025 schedule is causing concern. Head Coach Sean McDermott notes the odd timing of games. Thirteen of eighteen games are on Sundays. This impacts players' family time. McDermott is looking for rest periods within the schedule. The team aims to break their 13-4 record. Their ultimate goal is a Super Bowl appearance. They have not appeared since 1993.

title: Author Salman Rushdie's attacker sentenced to 25 years in prison
content: Hadi Matar received a 25-year prison sentence for the 2022 on-stage stabbing of Salman Rushdie at a lecture in New York. The attack, which left Rushdie blind in one eye and severely injured, stemmed from the decades-old fatwa. Matar, who criticized Rushdie before sentencing, faces a federal trial on terrorism charges related to the incident.

title: India A squad announced for England tour, Easwaran named captain
content: The All-India Senior Men’s Selection Committee has announced the India A squad for their upcoming tour of England. Abhimanyu Easwaran will captain the team, which includes promising talents like Yashasvi Jaiswal and Dhruv Jurel. India A is set to play two four-day matches against the England Lions in Canterbury and Northampton.

title: Pak's ex-air marshal admits AWACS damaged in Op Sindoor
content: Retired Pakistani Air Marshal Masood Akhtar admitted on camera that Indian precision strikes under Operation Sindoor damaged a Pakistani AWACS aircraft at Bholari airbase. The strikes, a retaliation for the Pahalgam terror attack, targeted key military installations, contradicting Pakistan's attempts to downplay the extent of the damage. Indian Air Marshal AK Bharti confirmed that 11 Pakistani air bases were hit.

title: 'Kohli was the batter everyone feared': RCB director on 2018 England tour memories
content: Despite retiring from Test cricket, Virat Kohli remains intensely focused on achieving success with Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL, according to team director Mo Bobat. Bobat lauded Kohli's remarkable Test career, highlighting his impressive statistics and leadership. Recalling Kohli's memorable performances, particularly the 2018 series against England, Bobat anticipates fans will shower him with affection.

title: Turkey-base Celebi moves HC over revoked security clearance
content: Celebi Airport Services India has challenged the government's revocation of its security clearance in Delhi High Court, citing vague national security concerns. The aviation firm argues the decision, impacting thousands of jobs and investor confidence, lacks justification and was issued without warning.

title: 'Protective son' Rohit steals hearts during Wankhede stand inauguration - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma was honoured at Wankhede Stadium with the inauguration of the 'Rohit Sharma Stand.' The event highlighted his cricketing achievements and his deep family values, particularly his affection for his parents. Sharma expressed gratitude to his family and supporters, acknowledging their sacrifices. The Mumbai Indians squad attended the ceremony, which also honored Ajit Wadekar, Sharad Pawar, and Amol Kale.

title: Supporting roles are no longer just ‘support’ — they are the new heroes of our stories
content: In the dazzling world of Bollywood, where stardom and celebrity often dominate headlines, it’s easy to overlook the consistent, nuanced, and sometimes transformative work of supporting actors. Yet, scratch beneath the surface of any memorable film, and you’ll find a character actor who anchored the story with authenticity, grace, and gravitas. These actors, often relegated to the background of red carpets and marquee posters, are the beating heart of storytelling. Their roles are not just supplementary—they are essential.

title: 'West trying to pit India against China': Russia foreign minister
content: Sergei Lavrov, the Russian foreign minister, has accused the West of attempting to create discord between India and China by promoting an anti-China agenda in the Indo-Pacific region. He warned that Western powers are also trying to diminish ASEAN's role in regional affairs by undermining consensus and encouraging divisive groupings.

title: US Planning To Permanently Relocate 1 Million Palestinians To Libya: Report
content: The Trump administration is working on a plan to permanently relocate as much as one million Palestinians from the Gaza Strip to Libya, NBC News reported on Friday, citing five people with knowledge of the matter.

title: 4-Year-Old Boy Dies Under Suspicious Circumstances In UP School: Cops
content: A four-year-old boy allegedly died under suspicious circumstances at a school here on Friday, with police suspecting that he was beaten by two teachers of the institution.

title: Macron Says Gaza Conditions "Intolerable", Hopes To Discuss It With Netanyahu, Trump
content: French President Emmanuel Macron reaffirmed on Friday that the humanitarian crisis in Gaza was unacceptable, and said he hoped to discuss the matter soon with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: "Kashmir Has Been Used As Weapon To Unite Pak": Ex Army Chief
content: The role of the Director General of Military Operations is in focus after the recent ceasefire between India and Pakistan was declared following a call between officers holding the rank in both countries.

title: Pet Escapes And Falls On Train Track? 20 Minutes To Retrieve It, Says France
content: In 2023, a departing train in Paris ran over a cat that had escaped from a traveller's bag, in a case that caused an uproar in France.

title: Tiger Kills Man In Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat, Eats Up Half His Body
content: A tiger killed a man in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district on Friday and ate a sizable part of the body, a forest department official said.

title: Hit Game "Fortnite" Unavailable On Apple Devices Worldwide
content: Hit game "Fortnite" was unavailable on Apple's digital App Store around the world on Friday, in the latest episode of a battle between the tech titan and publisher Epic Games.

title: UP Farmer's Son, Raj Mishra, Elected Mayor Of Market Town In England
content: A farmer's son from Mirzapur in Uttar Pradesh, who was elected as a local town councillor earlier this month, has been chosen as the new mayor of Wellingborough, a market town in Northamptonshire in the East Midlands region of England.

title: Israel Warns Houthi Leaders After Striking Yemen Ports
content: Israel threatened to target the leadership of Yemen's Iran-backed Houthi rebels after the air force struck two rebel-held ports on Friday, following repeated Houthi missile attacks in recent days.

title: Justin Bieber Not A Victim Of Sean 'Diddy' Combs, Says His Spokesperson
content: Singer Justin Bieber was not a victim of Sean "Diddy" Combs but supports others who were and are seeking justice from the hip-hop mogul facing federal sex trafficking charges, TMZ and People reported on Friday, quoting Bieber's representative.

title: Russia, Ukraine Agree To Swap 1,000 Prisoners Of War From Each Side
content: Russia said on Friday that the first direct talks with Ukraine in more than three years had yielded a deal to swap 1,000 prisoners of war each soon and to resume talks after each side had set out its vision for a future ceasefire.

title: Bihar To Give Rs 50 Lakh To Family Of Soldiers Killed In Action During Op Sindoor
content: The Bihar government on Friday announced that Rs 50 lakh ex gratia each would be given to the kin of personnel of the Army and CAPFs killed in action during Operation Sindoor.

title: 500 New Electric Buses To Delhi's Public Transport Fleet In Next 2 Months
content: Five hundred new electric buses will be rolled out on the city roads in the next two months, Delhi Transport Minister Pankaj Singh said on Friday.

title: King Charles Climbs Up UK Rich List, Matches Rishi Sunak's Wealth
content: Britain's King Charles III saw his wealth grow by around GBP 30 million over the past year to hit GBP 640 million in the 2025 'Sunday Times Rich List' released on Friday.

title: Man Who Stabbed Author Salman Rushdie Sentenced To 25 Years In Prison
content: The man convicted of stabbing Salman Rushdie on a New York lecture stage in 2022, leaving the prizewinning author blind in one eye, was sentenced Friday to serve 25 years in prison.

title: Watch: Albanian PM Kneels To Greet Italian PM Giorgia Meloni At EU Summit
content: Kneeling to greet Italy's Giorgia Meloni and gripping France's Emmanuel Macron in a bro hug, Albania's Prime Minister Edi Rama hosted Europe's leaders Friday with his showman's panache undampened by torrential rain.

title: Delhi To Constitute Welfare Board For Gig Workers, Frame Schemes
content: Delhi labour minister Kapil Mishra on Friday said the government will constitute a welfare board for gig and platform workers and frame schemes for their welfare.

title: "Level Of Anger Between India And Pak Was Not A Good Thing": Trump
content: US President Donald Trump, who has made repeated claims that his administration brokered a "ceasefire" between India and Pakistan, on Friday described it as a "big success" and said the level of anger between the two neighbours "was not a good thing.

title: Brain-Dead Woman Forced To Carry Fetus To Birth In US Because Of Abortion Ban
content: The law, known as the "heartbeat law," restricts abortion once cardiac activity is detected, which is generally around six weeks into pregnancy.

title: Playoff futures: Odds improving for Timberwolves as champs, Edwards as Finals MVP
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder (-135) remain the odds-on favorite to win the 2025 NBA championship even after dropping Game 6 at Denver on Thursday night . the team with the next-shortest odds has changed, however, as the Minnesota Timberwolves (+475) have leapfrogged the New York Knicks (+500) in the past 24 hours .

title: How Hansi Flick won the LaLiga title and took Barcelona back to the top
content: barca beat spanish rivals Espanyol 2-0 to clinch the laLiga title . they had already won the Supercopa de Espaa and the Copa del Rey . coach Hansi Flick inherits a team that had not won a trophy in two of the previous campaigns .

title: Potential upsets? Early favorites? We preview the 2025 softball regionals
content: the Oklahoma Sooners begin their quest for a fifth straight ring as the regionals begin on friday . eight of the overall top 10 seeds are from the conference . some of the best pitchers are playing for teams like Texas Tech (NiJaree Canady), Arizona State (Kenzie Brown).

title: Ballpark evictions, broken bats and Goliath vs. Goliath: The 10 hottest times in New York baseball history
content: baseball was invented in the city nearly 4,500 years ago . he writes in his book "Baseball in the Garden of Eden" he is regarded as one of the greatest military strategists and warrior pharaohs of all time .

title: Former Jets DB Adams likes idea of return to team
content: former All-Pro safety jamal Adams wants to run the Jets back in new york . he says he would love to be back with the team and, obviously, finish it the right way . "it would be a dream come true, just to patch up that relationship," he said .

title: 'She's a folk hero in our sport': How NiJaree Canady became college softball's first million-dollar player
content: nijaree canady landed the richest softball NIL deal ever . she had won just 49% of its games and 31% of its league games since the advent of the Big 12 . her new home would be on the arid plains of west Texas at a school .

title: The Boston Celtics and the price of history
content: the extended Boston Celtics franchise gathered in a theater to celebrate another championship . a few blocks from the Brahmin church where Bob Cousy eulogized John Havlicek, and from the four-star hotel where Red Auerbach lived . the party was a high table meeting of those witnesses and high priests .
